title: Pandasunda
author: Pandasunda
content: BOUNTY :ðŸ”´ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥$60K WORTH ofÂ  ETH REWARD FUND ðŸ”´ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥INCUBATEX LAUNCHPAD BOUNTYÂ  Â ðŸ”´ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥ðŸ”¥Quote from: daggny_taggart on May 24, 2022, 02:45:17 AMImportant Announcement! Our Twitter has been suspended because of the bots' activity! Unfortunately, lot's of Bounty members that have joined turned out to be bots. We are working to restore our account and we will reward all the participants as agreed! However after access is regained we will take a closer look at Twitter participants and accounts that have posted generic comments like " it is good project team is good I believe it is success" etc - will be disqualified. Please read our posts and comment only if you have something relevant to say. We don't want to hear fake praises. Â This only harms our company I want to know what you think about a bounty Campaign twitter account being suspended because bot's activity.Is it 100% thatÂ  was caused by the fault of the bounty campaign participants themselves? If you are the project owner, what can you do?

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: The account has been suspended (https://twitter.com/IncubateX_NFT) but no one knows the exact reason unless if the owners show you proof. Maybe a screenshot of the message about their suspension.Very many bounties employ bot like accounts to follow, tweet and retweet anyway, so I wouldn't be surprised if it was the cause.

comments.author: TheBeardedBaby
comments.body: Lol, it's just another example of another useless project. It you don't have control over what your "workers" are doing then they need to change the campaign manager. That's just a disaster for the project.

comments.author: asriloni
comments.body: It's so funny to see that. The project poorly handled by incompetence manager. Its manager didn't even gradually checking the participants or making only qualified participants that can participate in the campaign. If the twitter owned by the project getting banned and this is just a common thing. This is showing how bad the campaign manager can affect the project itself.
